title: Join Us
text:
What we work on

Multihazard and cascading event modelling
Machine learning for hazard detection and forecasting
Uncertainty-aware prediction and evaluation
End-to-end warning pipelines and decision support
Open tools, reproducible science, and real-world impact

title: Join Us
text:
Who we are looking for

PhD / MSc students
Strong quantitative background (e.g., ML, statistics, physics, engineering, geoscience) and interest in hazards/resilience.


Postdocs
Evidence of independent research, strong writing, and a clear agenda aligned with our themes.


Research software / engineering
Experience with ML tooling, data pipelines, and reproducibility.

title: Join Us
text:
How to reach out
Email lorenzo.nava@kcl.ac.uk with: - a short paragraph describing your interest, - a CV, - (optional) a link to papers / GitHub, - (optional) 1–2 project ideas.

title: About
text:
The Hazard Systems Research Group (HazSys) conducts research on the modelling and analysis of multihazard risk and resilience, with a particular focus on the use of artificial intelligence and data-driven methods to understand complex hazard systems.
Our research focuses on AI-enabled multihazard forecasting, early warning systems, and response, combining data-driven models with system-level perspectives on risk and resilience.



Multihazard and cascading risk modelling

AI and machine learning for hazard analysis

System-level approaches to risk and resilience

Decision support for risk reduction and adaptation




The group is led by Lorenzo Nava, AI+ Academic Senior Fellow at King’s College London.




Email: lorenzo.nava@kcl.ac.uk

Location: King’s College London
